creator: @next

content: - if IMAP, select account settings>synchronization&storage, click advanced button to verify that all desired folders can be used offline - if IMAP, then select file>offline>download Now, whether IMAP or POP, do the following: - install the importexporttools addon - highlight one of the account folders - rightclick and select importexport menu item to export mbox - repeat for all folders. - then, create new folders for each of the account folders in the local folders section - highlight one of the new folders, - rightclick and select importexport menu to import mbox and select the desired folder you previously exported - repeat for each folder. - afterverifying all is okay, you can delete messages in the account folder, if desired.
creator: davidsk

content:
Yes, you're okay with Thunderbird if you are using the specified Microsoft input and SMTP servers and OAUTH2. The Microsoft link even spoke to the specific Thunderbird changes: 

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/modern-authentication-methods-now-needed-to-continue-syncing-outlook-email-in-non-microsoft-email-apps-c5d65390-9676-4763-b41f-d7986499a90d

Many users were already okay, but this is a notice for those still using 'normal password' This URL also provides that: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202
creator: davidsk

content: You will never access the account until you click 'allow.' This is a security concern of Google's, not Thunderbird's. Once allowed, Google will place a unique code into the password field and the prompting will cease.
creator: davidsk
